name: Orzo with Feta, Cucumber and Tomato
author: Michaelc
summary: Beat the summer heat with this Greek special. Makes a large batch and is good for parties, picnic or keep it all to yourself. Will stay in the fridge for 4 days or so. This is real nice for summer get-togethers and parties and you can make it well in advance.
ingredients: 1  red bell pepper, seeded and chopped - divided
1  red onion, very thinly sliced and cut into 1-inch pieces
1 cup pitted Kalamata olives, coarsely chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place orzo pasta, chicken broth, water, and half the chopped red bell pepper into a saucepan
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until orzo are tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 10 minutes
Place orzo into a large salad bowl with remaining red bell pepper and 2 tablespoons olive oil; toss to coat
Mix in cucumbers, feta cheese, roma tomatoes, red onion, Kalamata olives, lemon juice, white wine vinegar, and cumin; toss salad well
Drizzle 2 more tablespoons olive oil over top of salad
Refrigerate 1 hour, tossing once or twice; season to taste with salt and black pepper before serving
